intro: Cacalia eupatoriodes, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Cacalia eupatoriodes is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
